message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this incredible product. It's a one-of-a-kind opportunity to own something truly unique. I'm willing to sell it to you for $999000. I believe this is a fair price considering its value to you, and I'm confident you'll find it's worth every penny.
I'm very interested in the product, but $999000 is a bit higher than I was hoping to pay. I was thinking more along the lines of $900000. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand your concerns about the price, but I'm afraid $900000 is still a bit low for me. However, I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can offer it to you for $950000. This is the lowest price I'm willing to go, and I believe it's still a great value for the product. What do you think?

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Alice, but $950000 is still a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to pay $920000 for the product. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement.

I understand that you're trying to be reasonable, Bob, but I'm afraid $920000 is still not enough for me. I've already compromised quite a bit, and I'm not willing to go any lower. I'm willing to make one more offer, and that's $970000. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement. If not, I'll have to consider other options.

I understand that you're not willing to go any lower, Alice, but I'm afraid $970000 is still too high for me. I'm willing to walk away if we can't come to an agreement. I'll make one final offer: $910000. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider buying the product from John for $1200000.
